Activity: Arrive at the office, check emails, and review yesterday's work.

Continue implementing the order management component of the trade execution module. Focus on handling different order types (market, limit, stop) and implementing order lifecycle management (submission, cancellation, modification).
Address feedback from @sdev-2 regarding the previous debugging request. Refactor code based on suggested improvements and add more robust error handling.

Explore different message queuing technologies (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka) for inter-module communication. Evaluate their suitability for handling high-throughput order flow and real-time market data updates.

Design the interface between the trade execution module and the data analysis module. Define the data format for passing market data and order execution reports. Ensure data integrity and consistency across modules.
Lunch Break. Catch up with colleagues in the lunchroom.

Begin prototyping the data analysis module. Focus on building a basic time series analysis pipeline using pandas and numpy. Implement functions for calculating simple moving averages, volatility, and correlation.

Consult with @qres-1 @qres-2 @qres-3 to understand the specific analytical requirements for the trading strategies. Identify key features and indicators that need to be extracted from the market data.

Integrate the data analysis pipeline with the trade execution module. Simulate a simple trading strategy using historical market data and evaluate its performance. Identify bottlenecks and areas for optimization.
Document the data analysis pipeline and API. Create a user guide for researchers and traders on how to use the module to generate trading signals.
Code review and prepare for tomorrow. Read up on advanced time series analysis techniques (e.g., Kalman filters, ARIMA models).
